1022.01  DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Construction" means the construction of new work where no work has
previously been done.
   (b)   "Contractor" means any person or company licensed by the City to
construct or reconstruct walks or driveways, and to perform other work
permitted under this chapter, acting directly or through a duly authorized
representative.
   (c)   "Curb opening" means that part of a curb which has been or is cut,
dropped or replaced.
   (d)   "Driveway" means any driveway approach or runway between the curb line
and private property line.
   (e)   "Driveway culvert" means any storm sewer conduit that crosses under a
driveway with an open waterway on either side of the driveway.
   (f)   "Inspector" means the inspector designated by the Municipal
Administrator.
   (g)   "Owner" means the owner, leaseholder or agent of thereof holding title
to any private property adjoin any street in the City.
   (h)   "Reconstruction" means the relaying, rebuilding or repair of old work
in part or in whole.
   (i)   "Right-of-way" means any public property dedicated for public use as a
street, avenue, boulevard, lane, alley or public thoroughfare.
   (j)   "Walk" means any main or approach sidewalk, between the curb line and
a private property line.
(Res. 88-9.  Passed 5-26-88; Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.02  RESPONSIBILITY FOR MAINTENANCE.
   (a)   Where required by Council, every owner of any lot or parcel of land
situated within the corporate limits of the City shall construct, keep, repair
and maintain, along all public street, avenues, boulevards or lanes adjoining
thereto, sidewalks as recommended by standard engineering practices as approved
by the City Engineer.
   (b)   The cost of such construction, keeping and maintaining shall be the
responsibility of the individual property owner, or of the City and the
property owner together, as determined from time to time by Council.
(Res. 88-9.  Passed 5-26-88; Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.03  COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   All sidewalks, driveway approaches, runways or curb openings hereafter
constructed, reconstruct or made on any public street, avenue, boulevard or
lane within the corporate limits of the City shall be constructed,
reconstructed or made, and shall be used and maintained, in accordance with
this chapter.  Any person desiring to engage in the construction or
reconstruction of walks or driveways, or to make curb openings shall be
conditioned upon the faithful observance of this chapter and other applicable
provisions of these Codified Ordinances and the specifications, rules or
regulations pertaining to the construction and reconstruction of walks,
driveways or curb openings, and upon the principal constructing, reconstructing
or making all walks, driveways or curb openings in strict compliance with all
applicable existing ordinances, specifications, rules and regulations of the
City.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.04  CONSTRUCTION PERMITS.
   (a)   Applications.  An application for a permit to construct or reconstruct
a walk or driveway, or to make a curb opening, shall be on forms furnished by
the Municipal Administrator.  No walk shall be constructed or reconstructed
until a permit has been obtained from the Municipal Administrator by the owner
of the contiguous property or his or her agent. A contractor must ascertain
that a permit has been procured before he or she constructs or reconstructs any
sidewalk to driveway or makes any curb opening.  The permit must be kept on the
site of the construction or reconstruction until completion of the work.
   (b)   Fee.
      (1)   The fee to be collected for the issuance of curb cut, sidewalk and
driveway construction permits in conformity with this section shall be paid by
the applicant upon obtaining the permit and shall be as set forth in
Chapter 208 of the Administration Code - the General Fee Schedule.
      (2)   Fees shall be payable at the office of the Finance and Revenue
Director. In the case of reconstruction, fees may be waived at the discretion
of the Director if it is determined that the condition giving rise to the need
for reconstruction was caused by the City.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.05  NOTICE TO CONSTRUCT OR RECONSTRUCT.
   Notice to construct or reconstruct walks or driveways or to make curb
openings shall be as provided by law. Council may, by resolution, order
sidewalks or driveways to be repaired or reconstructed, and the costs thereof
shall be assessed and collected as provided by law.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.06  CONSTRUCTION BY CITY; COSTS.
   If the owner neglects to construct or reconstruct a walk or driveway within
the time specified by Council, the Municipal Administrator shall construct or
reconstruct such walk or driveway or cause the same to be done. In such case,
the cost and expense of constructing or reconstructing such walk or driveway
shall, as directed by ordinance of Council, be assessed as provided by law
against the adjoining or abutting property, lot or land.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.07  CURB CUTS.
   All concrete or stone curbs shall be cut by an experienced and competent
curb cutter, and the dropping or removal of any curb shall be done only by an
experienced curb setter.  The replacing of a curb shall be done by the owner or
by the City, through the Municipal Administrator by contract or force account
as the Municipal Administrator may deem best, and the cost and expense for such
work shall be charged against the private property contiguous to the right-of-
way where such curb was replaced. No curb opening shall be less than twelve
linear feet in width or of a greater width than approved by the Municipal
Administrator.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.08  LOCATION OF SIDEWALKS.
   Walks shall be located on the public right-of-way as determined by the
Municipal Administrator.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.09  CONSTRUCTION SPECIFICATIONS.
   (a)   No concrete walk shall be less than four inches in thickness. The
width shall be a minimum of four feet.
   (b)   In the repairing of sidewalks, no patching will be allowed except at
the discretion of the Municipal Administrator. Temporary repairs can be made
with asphalt, or a temporary asphalted concrete walk may be placed where a
tree, due to its growth, would irreparably damage a concrete walk.
   (c)   Any stone or concrete slab that can be trimmed to not less than two
feet for the full width may be used when specifically permitted by the
Municipal Administrator, and no closure of any walk can be less than two feet
for the full width of the slab.
   (d)   All sidewalks over subspace shall be of reinforced concrete
construction or reconstruction only, the plans for which must be approved by
the Municipal Administrator.
   (e)   All driveways shall be constructed with a six-inch thick plain
concrete slab or a two-inch thick asphalted concrete surface course on a four-
inch thick stone base. The kind of material and the construction specifications
therefor are subject to approval by the Municipal Administrator.  Unless
specifically authorized by the Municipal Administrator, the driveway within the
limits of the sidewalk shall be six-inch plain concrete only, for a minimum
width of one foot beyond the driveway on each side, and must be effectively
separated from the sidewalk by an expansion joint. The driveway shall be the
same width at the curb line as the curb opening and not less than eight feet in
width at the street side of the sidewalk.
   (f)   When and if any driveway is no longer used for driveway purposes, it
shall be considered abandoned and the City reserves and shall have the right to
forthwith take the necessary steps to close the driveway, replace the curb and
restore the pavement to its original condition. The owner of the property
served by such driveway shall be notified by personal service or registered
mail of the City's intention to close the driveway. After fifteen days from the
date of notice, if the owner has failed to make the replacement or to contact
the Municipal Administrator, the Municipal Administrator shall proceed with the
work of restoring the curb and pavement to the original condition. The cost of
such work shall be charged against the abutting property, and if not paid,
shall be certified to the proper taxing authority for collection in the manner
provided by law.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.10  INSPECTIONS AND NOTICES PRIOR TO CONSTRUCTION.
   No walks or driveways shall be constructed or reconstructed until an
inspection has been made and until lines and levels are authorized and given by
the Municipal Administrator. No driveway shall be constructed or reconstructed
where the same is to be used in conjunction with a filling station or
commercial or industrial building if such driveway is less than sixty-five feet
from the intersecting curb line to its nearest side on the stop side of any
main thoroughfare. Notice shall be given to the Municipal Administrator not
less than twenty-four hours or more than forty-eight hours prior to starting
the work on any driveway or sidewalk.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.11  INSTALLATION OF UTILITY FIXTURES OR SIDEWALK GRATINGS.
   Any person installing or placing, or causing to be installed or placed, any
curb box for gas or water, gas drips, manhole covers or sidewalk gratings shall
install them so that they are on an exact level with the surface of the walk or
driveway. When walks are reconstructed, all such appurtenances shall be set
flush with the new sidewalk or driveway grade.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.12  PROTECTION OF FIRE HYDRANTS, VEGETATION AND GUTTERS; BARRICADES AND
WARNING LIGHTS.
   (a)   Any person constructing, reconstructing or removing walks, driveways
or curb openings, or causing the same to be done, shall, at all times, maintain
free access to fire hydrants.  No material or dirt shall be stacked, piled or
placed within fifteen feet of such fire hydrants. Such person shall protect all
trees, lawns, shrubbery and other improvements from damage. Gutters shall, at
all times, be kept free of dirt or debris.
   (b)   Where it is necessary to place any material, debris or dirt on public
property, such material, debris or dirt shall be removed on the completion of
the work and the surface restored to its previous condition. The Municipal
Administrator shall, if in his or her opinion it is necessary, require the
person doing or causing such work to be done to seed or resod such part of any
lawn as he or she may deem necessary.
   (c)   Any person performing any such work shall maintain such proper
barricades, fences, signal lights or other protection as shall conform to
applicable ordinances or safety regulations, shall maintain access to private
entrance walks and safe accommodations for pedestrian traffic and shall, so far
as possible, maintain access to private driveways.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.13  DRAINAGE FOR WALKS.
   Drainage for walks shall be provided by grading between the walk and the
curb or ditch, at such places as may be necessary in the opinion of and as
directed by the Municipal Administrator.  The cost shall be borne by the owner
of the property abutting the right-of-way.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.14  GRADES GENERALLY.
   (a)   All grades for walks shall conform to street grades, which shall be
established by the Municipal Administrator.
   (b)   All walks and driveways shall be constructed or reconstructed to
conform to the grade on the right-of-way where the grade has been established.
   (c)   The surface of all walks shall have a transverse slope of one-fourth
inch to one-half inch per foot, with the low side nearest to the curb line.
   (d)   Whenever permission is requested and granted to construct or
reconstruct a walk where the surface of such walk has a transverse slope of a
rate of more than one-half inch to the foot, the permit shall be granted and
received only on the condition that Council may, at anytime thereafter, order
such walk to be reconstructed to the established grade of the right-of-way,
entirely at the expense of the abutting property owner.
   (e)   In all cases where a sidewalk crosses a driveway or runway, the full
width of the sidewalk shall conform to the established grade of the sidewalks
adjoining both sides of such driveway or runway, unless permission has been
first obtained from the Municipal Administrator.  However, in all cases, not
less than a three-foot with of sidewalk shall conform to the grade of the
sidewalks adjoining both sides of the.
   (f)   Upon a right-of-way where the grade has been established but where the
street has not been improved by paving or grading to such grade, walks shall be
constructed in conformity with the established grade or as specified in the
legislation providing for the construction or reconstruction of walks,
driveways, and curb openings. However, when walks shall be ordered by Council
or shall be constructed or reconstructed without such order by the owner of
property abutting on a right-of-way where no grade is established, such walks
may be constructed or reconstructed at such levels and inclinations as may be
prescribed by the Municipal Administrator. When permission is requested of and
granted by the Municipal Administrator to construct or reconstruct a walk on
such right-of-way, it shall be granted and the walk shall be constructed or
reconstructed only on the condition that when a grade shall be established,
such walk shall be removed and reconstructed to the grade which may thereafter
be established by the Municipal Administrator for such street, entirely at the
expense of the owner of the property abutting on such street.
   (g)   Whenever a sidewalk is reconstructed to a grade that does not meet the
grade of adjacent existing walks, the person constructing the new sidewalk
shall construct a ramp to eliminate any stub toes or grade inequality.  The
materials, workmanship and character of the ramp shall be as determined by the
Municipal Administrator.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.15  UNIFORMITY OF GRADES.
   All walks hereafter constructed or reconstructed on any right-of-way in the
City shall be constructed or reconstructed on such plans, inclination and level
that the wearing surface thereof shall be uniform and even throughout the
right-of-way. All walks in the City shall be maintained in such repair by the
owner of property abutting the right-of-way that the surface of the walk in
front of the length and width with the adjoining and connecting walks. All new
lateral walks, from the main sidewalk to the property line, hereafter
constructed, shall have a uniform slope from the main sidewalk to the property
line of from one-fourth inch to one-half inch per foot. The low end of the new
lateral walk shall be adjacent to the main sidewalk, and the lateral walk shall
meet the grade of the main sidewalk. The intent of this section is to exclude
steps or other abrupt changes in grade on the right-of-way.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.16  LINE AND GRADE STAKES.
   (a)   The Municipal Administrator or his or her agent shall furnish line and
grade stakes as may be necessary for the proper control of the work regulated
by this chapter. However, this shall not relieve the owner or contractor of any
responsibility for making careful and accurate measurements in constructing the
work to the lines furnished by the Municipal Administrator or his or her agent.
The owner or contractor shall preserve the stakes set for line and grade. Such
stakes for line or grade which are disturbed or destroyed through the
carelessness of the owner or contractor shall be replaced by the Municipal
Administrator or his or her agent upon the request of the owner or contractor,
or as deemed necessary by the Municipal Administrator or his or her agent. The
owner or contractor will be responsible for the actual cost of this work, as
determined by the Municipal Administrator.
   (b)   The Municipal Administrator may not authorize work for providing line
and grade of sidewalks on lots where a house is proposed until after the
foundation of the house is finished and all utility construction is complete
driveway or runway.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.17  SUSPENSION OF WORK.
   The owner or contractor shall suspend all work regulated by this chapter
when notified by the Municipal Administrator that the weather is unsuitable for
carrying on the work. If work is allowed during cold or freezing weather, the
owner or contractor shall take such additional precautions as the Municipal
Administrator shall require or as set forth in the specifications. No work
shall be done between November 15 and April 15 without special permission from
the Municipal Administrator.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.18  CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS.
   (a)   The owner or contractor shall furnish satisfactory evidence as to the
kind and quality of materials intended for use in the construction or
reconstruction of walks or driveways, either separately or in combination.
   (b)   Such material shall be packaged and marked so as to permit
identification.
   (c)   All material used on any work shall be subject to tests, for the
purpose of ascertaining quality, strength, durability, etc., and for the
purpose of ascertaining that the same meets the requirements of the
specifications for the construction or reconstruction of walks and driveways as
established by the Municipal Administrator.
   (d)   Walks shall be constructed of materials approved by the Municipal
Administrator.
   (e)   Whenever the Municipal Administrator deems it necessary, bituminous
material shall be placed adjacent to all telephone or power poles or other
structures which are within the limits of a sidewalk. The materials workmanship
and character of this construction shall be determined by the Municipal
Administrator.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.19  SUPERVISION.
   (a)   The Municipal Administrator shall, at all times, have access to the
work regulated by this chapter, and the contractor shall provide proper
facilities or cause the same to be provided for the inspection of all work.
   (b)   The owner or contractor shall have a responsible representative in
charge of the work on the site at all times, and he or she shall have the
necessary qualifications and authority to execute, adhere to and carry out all
the requirements of this chapter and of the specifications for the construction
or reconstruction of walks, driveways or curb openings, on file in the office
of the Municipal Administrator.
   (c)   Orders or instructions from the Municipal Administrator or from the
inspector given to the representative shall be as binding as though given to
the owner or contractor. If any person employed on the work refuses or neglects
to comply with the direction of the work, or, in the opinion of the Municipal
Administrator the City Engineer, or the inspector, is incompetent, disorderly
or unfaithful, such a person shall be immediately removed and not again
employed on any part of the work.
   (d)   The Municipal Administrator shall assign an inspector to the work or
such part thereof as may be necessary. However, the presence of the inspector
will not in any way relieve the owner or contractor from any responsibility in
complying with the specifications relating to the construction or
reconstruction of walks, driveways or curb openings. Any work done or performed
contrary to this chapter or the applicable rules or specifications shall, upon
direction of the Municipal Administrator, be made good or removed as directed.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.20  RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   The Municipal Administrator is hereby authorized to adopt, promulgate, amend
and enforce such administrative rules and regulations as may be necessary to
execute and enforce this chapter.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.21  SEPARATE PERMITS REQUIRED.
   An individual permit shall be required for each separate job for which a
charge will be made.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.22  SIDEWALKS IN SUBDIVISIONS.
   In all new subdivisions, the developer shall comply with the requirements of
the Subdivision Regulations concerning sidewalks. The required sidewalks shall
be provided at the expense of the developer.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.23  NEW SIDEWALKS; COSTS; ASSESSMENTS.
   In the developed sections of the City that have never previously had
sidewalks constructed, the following shall apply:
   (a)   New sidewalks in a new subdivision shall be paid for entirely by the
developer or purchaser of a lot in a new subdivision as provided by ordinance.
   (b)   When other new sidewalks in other parts of the City are required, the
same shall be constructed at the sole cost of the owner and/or developer. When
the City requires the construction of sidewalks, the City shall share in side
lot relief of corner lots. The owner shall pay for the longer frontage of a
corner lot and for one-third of the cost of the shorter frontage of a corner
lot. The City shall pay two-thirds of the cost of the shorter frontage of a
corner lot.
   (c)   In addition, the City shall pay for the sidewalk construction costs in
intersections and for two percent of the overall costs when such construction
is required by the City.
   (d)   Owners of record who are sixty-five years of age or older may have any
sidewalk assessments deferred for ten years if such senior citizen has an
annual income of less than ten thousand dollars ($10,000).
   (e)   The City shall include costs of engineering for sidewalk improvements.
   (f)   The City shall pay, in full, costs of all sidewalks at intersections
located within the street right-of-way.
   (g)   The City shall not use the assessment procedure to place the costs of
new sidewalks upon the tax duplicate according to law unless the owners of
sixty percent of the front footage of the property abutting an entire block
petition Council for such construction.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.24  SIDEWALK REPAIRS; COSTS.
   (a)   If the damage to a sidewalk was caused by action of the City in
raising the grade of the street higher than the sidewalk level so that the
sidewalk damage occurred, or if the damage to the sidewalk was caused by trees
approved by the City, in the right-of-way by growth of roots, then the City
shall pay 100 percent of the cost of the repairs.
   (b)   The City shall notify the owner of the need to replace or repair
sidewalks where the damage to the sidewalk was not caused by the City as set
forth in subsection (a) hereof, but where the repairs are necessary because of
deterioration of the sidewalk from time and use. If the owner fails to repair
or replace the sidewalk within thirty days, the City of Northwood may make the
necessary repairs or replacement of the sidewalk at the property owner's
expense. The property owner will be assessed 100 percent of repair cost. The
City may make the repairs or contract for the repairs to be done by an outside
source.
   (c)   The Sidewalk Commission and Hearing Board shall make the determination
of the priority of sidewalks that should be repaired by the City, where the
damage is caused by the City as set forth in subsection (a) hereof, so that the
repairs can be made based upon the priority list as determined by the
Commission.
   (d)   If private property owners have requested repairs and have deposited
100 percent of the estimated cost with the Finance and Revenue Director, the
City shall make such repairs on a first-come and first-serve basis according to
available City funds as appropriated in each calendar year.
   (e)   All sidewalks shall be made to the specifications of width, grade and
depth of the concrete over both walk areas and driveway areas according to the
plans approved by the Municipal Administrator.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.25  DRIVEWAY CULVERT.
   (a)   When installing a new driveway over an existing storm swale or ditch
between the curb line or edge of pavement and private line the owner shall
install a driveway culvert to all the storm water to flow uninterrupted under
the driveway.
   (b)   Sizing and grading of the driveway culver shall be determined by the
City Service Director and/or City Engineer.
   (c)   Material specifications for the driveway culver shall be as follows:
      (1)   Conduit size ten inches in diameter or greater shall be reinforced
concrete conduit meeting the Ohio Department of Transportation (ODOT)
requirement of item 706.02 with 706.11 joints.
      (2)   Conduit size eight inches in diameter or less with a minimum cover
over the top of pipe to the bottom of the driveway subgrade of twelve inches
can be polyvinyl chloride (PVC) conduit meeting ODOT requirement of item 707.45
with ASTMD 3212 joints. If minimum cover over the top of pip is less than
twelve inches, the conduit shall meet the requirements of Section 102.26(c)(1).
   (d)   The City will provide the construction staking to install the driveway
culvert. The cost of the construction staking shall be the responsibility of
the individual property owner and reimbursed back to the City.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.26  HARDSHIP.
   The City will pay fifty percent of the cost to repair or replace sidewalks
as provided herein for those property owners who qualify using the same
guidelines that the Ohio Department of Job & Family Services uses for its
emergency food assistance program. The property owner must make request to the
City Administrator in order to qualify for emergency hardship.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
1022.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
chapter is guilty of a minor misdemeanor on a first offense and shall be fined
not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). On each subsequent offense such
person is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree and shall be fined not
more than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) or imprisoned not more than
thirty days, or both. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day
during or on which a violation or noncompliance occurs or continues.
(Ord. 2015-12.  Passed 7-13-15.)
CHAPTER 1024
Excavations
1024.01   Permit required; fee.
1024.02   Bond required.
1024.03   Exceptions.
1024.04   Deposit required.
1024.05   Use of moneys.
1024.06   Barricades and warning lights.
1024.07   Backfilling; maximum length of ditch.
1024.08   Time limitations.
1024.09   Display of permit.
1024.99   Penalty.
   CROSS REFERENCES
   Openings by the Municipality - see Ohio R.C. 723.23, 723.31
   Liability for damage - see Ohio R.C. 723.49 et seq.
   Digging, excavating and piling earth on streets - see Ohio R.C. 5589.10
   Obstruction of public ways - see TRAF.
412.01; GEN. OFF.
660.05
   Dangerous excavations - see GEN. OFF. 634.01(c)
1024.01  PERMIT REQUIRED; FEE.
   (a)   No person shall open up or break into the streets, lanes, alleys,
public ways or public grounds of the Village for the purpose of connecting with
the water or gas pipes or with the sewers, drains or ditches or for any other
purpose until such person has first obtained a permit to do so from the Clerk-
Treasurer.
(Ord. 68-23. Passed 6-13-68.)
   (b)   The fee for the permit required by division (a) of this section shall
be as set forth in
Chapter 208 of the Administration Code - the General Fee Schedule.
(Ord. 94-59. Passed 11-22-94.)
1024.02  BOND REQUIRED.
   Before a permit required by Section
1024.01 is issued, the applicant therefor shall deposit with the Clerk-
Treasurer a bond with a good and sufficient surety, to the approval of the
Solicitor, in the sum of one thousand dollars ($1,000), conditioned upon
securing and holding harmless the Village against any and all damage arising
from any opening or excavation made in the streets, public ways or public
grounds of the Village under authority of such permit and further conditioned
upon filling up and placing in good and safe condition, to the satisfaction of
the Clerk-Treasurer, all openings and excavations so made in the streets,
public ways and public grounds of the Village, but such bond shall not be held
for the replacement or repair of the pavement, which work shall be done by the
Village as hereinafter specified. An annual bond may be given under this
section on May 1 of each year, conditioned as above as to all openings and
excavations made in the streets, public ways and public places by the principal
on such bond during the term of one year from such date.
(Ord. 68-23. Passed 6-13-68.)
1024.03  EXCEPTIONS.
   The provisions of Section
1024.02 shall not apply to any person licensed to make connections with the
public sewers or drains of the Village, nor shall any of the provisions of this
chapter apply to persons engaged in making public improvements in the streets,
public ways and public grounds of the Village under contract with and thereunto
directly authorized by the Village, nor to any governmental agency.
(Ord. 68-23. Passed 6-13-68.)
1024.04  DEPOSIT REQUIRED.
   No person shall break into, open up or disturb the pavement or any paved
streets, lanes, alleys, public ways or public grounds of the Village, without
having first deposited with the Clerk-Treasurer a sum of money sufficient to
pay for the replacement and repair of such pavement; such sum of money shall be
determined by the Clerk-Treasurer and no person shall open or disturb a greater
area of pavement than that authorized by the permit and for which such deposit
has been made.
(Ord. 68-23. Passed 6-13-68.)
1024.05  USE OF MONEYS.
   Moneys collected by the Clerk-Treasurer under the provisions of this chapter
shall be deposited in the proper Village fund and disbursed solely for the
purpose of paying for the repair and replacement of any pavement broken into or
disturbed for any of the purposes mentioned herein.
(Ord. 68-23. Passed 6-13-68.)
1024.06  BARRICADES AND WARNING LIGHTS.
   Every person making or having made openings or excavations in the streets,
alleys, lanes or public places of the Village shall at all times guard the same
with sufficient and suitable guardrails and with proper lights to warn and
protect persons and animals traveling upon such street or other public way or
place and anyone who neglects the duty imposed by this section shall, in
addition to the fine imposed, be liable for all damage to any person or
property resulting from such neglect.
(Ord. 68-23. Passed 6-13-68.)
1024.07  BACKFILLING; MAXIMUM LENGTH OF DITCH.
   Whenever any gas or natural gas company, steam power company, telephone or
telegraph company, electric light company or other person makes or causes to be
made any excavation in any of the paved streets, avenues, alleys or public
places of the Village or in any streets, avenues, alleys or public places of
the Village for which legislation at the time of making such excavation is
pending to improve the same by paving, for the purpose of laying down pipes or
wires or for any other purpose, such person shall, without delay, fill the
excavation caused by removing the earth with pure lake sand free from earth or
other impurities, or such other material as directed by the Clerk-Treasurer,
and replace all other materials which such person has removed or may remove or
disturb in making such excavations so that the street is put in good and
permanent condition and repair, the same as it was before such excavation was
made or materials removed. In no case shall the person have more than fifteen
rods of ditch open on any one street at any one time. Before breaking ground on
more than fifteen rods, such person shall fully reinstate and repair all other
portions of the street or place which he has disturbed. If such person refuses
or neglects to do so, the Clerk-Treasurer is hereby authorized to cause such
ditches to be filled and the street repaired and shall collect the expense and
cost of the same from such person by civil action in any court having
jurisdiction.
(Ord. 68-23. Passed 6-13-68.)
1024.08  TIME LIMITATIONS.
   (a)   No excavation made in any street, alley, lane or public place of the
Village shall remain open for a longer time than is absolutely necessary to do
the work prescribed in the permit granted for such excavation, and the person
making such excavation shall refill the same without delay with such material
as the Clerk-Treasurer directs, and to the satisfaction of the Clerk-Treasurer,
and shall completely fill such excavation to the surface of the pavement and
shall put all such excavations in a condition safe for public travel upon such
street or other public way or place.
   (b)   The Clerk-Treasurer shall have full power to order, at the time the
permit is granted, that a crew of men be employed by the person obtaining the
permit twenty-four hours a day until the street, alley, lane or public place of
the Village is in the same condition in which it was before such excavation was
made.
(Ord. 68-23. Passed 6-13-68.)
1024.09  DISPLAY OF PERMIT.
   No person who is engaged in disturbing the pavement of or breaking into or
excavating in the streets or other public ways or grounds of the Village shall
fail, by himself or by his agent, upon demand, to exhibit to any Village
official or police officer the written permit provided for in Section
1024.01.
(Ord. 68-23. Passed 6-13-68.)
1024.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
chapter shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate
offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on which a violation
occurs or continues.
CHAPTER 1028
Grade Crossings
1028.01   Lighting required.
   CROSS REFERENCES
   Lighting railroads - see Ohio R.C. 723.33 et seq.
   Stopping at grade crossings see TRAF.
432.31 et seq.
1028.01  LIGHTING REQUIRED.
   (a)   The following railroad crossings shall be lighted:
      (1)   Oak Street Crossing near Andrus Road at the Penn Central Railroad;
      (2)   Andrus Road Crossing east of East Broadway between East Broadway
and Tracy Roads at the Penn Central Crossing;
      (3)   Wales Road Crossing between Tracy Road and East Broadway at the
Penn Central Railroad;
      (4)   Drouillard Road Crossing north of Wales Road at the Penn Central
Railroad;
      (5)   Wales Road Crossing east of Drouillard Road between Drouillard and
Woodville Roads at the Penn Central Railroad Crossing;
      (6)   Wales Road Crossing east of East Broadway between East Broadway and
Drouillard Road at the C & O Railroad Crossing;
      (7)   Wales Road Crossing west of Drouillard Road between East Broadway
and Drouillard Road at the Toledo Terminal Railroad Crossing.
   (b)   All of the above crossings will be lighted with 2-400 watt high
pressure sodium lights.
   (c)   These lights are to be installed with poles with overhead supply in
accordance with plans and specifications and estimates heretofore prepared and
now on file in the office of the Clerk-Treasurer which plans, specifications
and estimates are hereby approved. Such lights shall be installed and operated
and the cost of such lights shall be borne by the railroad companies involved
pursuant to Ohio R.C. 723.33 to 723.37 inclusive.
(Ord. 73-74. Passed 11-21-73. )
CHAPTER 1032
Trees and Shrubbery
EDITOR'S NOTE: This chapter, formerly a codification of Ordinance 63-20, passed
August 26, 1963, was repealed by implication upon the adoption of Ordinance
2002-36, passed August 22, 2002, codified herein.
1032.01   Definitions.
1032.02   Duty of private property owner.
1032.03   City may remove.
1032.04   City responsibility.
1032.05   Trees prohibited on public property.
1032.06   Abuse or mutilation of public trees.
1032.07   Placing materials on public property.
1032.08   Planting and maintenance of tree lawns.
1032.09   Trees in new subdivisions.
1032.10   Tree spacing.
1032.11   Distance from curb and sidewalk.
1032.12   Distance from street corners and fire plugs.
1032.13   Utilities.
1032.14   Tree Commission.
1032.99   Penalty.
   CROSS REFERENCES
   Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715. 20
   Assessments for tree planting or maintenance - see Ohio R.C. 727.011
   Trees causing nuisance - see GEN. OFF. 634.01(b)
   Injuring vines, bushes, trees or crops - see GEN. OFF.
642.06
   Burning of trees - see GEN. OFF.
660.16
1032.01  DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   “Person” means any person, firm, partnership, association,
corporation, company, or organization of any kind.
   (b)   “Property line” means the outer edge of a street or highway.
   (c)   “Property owner” means the person owning such property as shown by the
County Auditor's Plat of the City of Northwood, Wood County, Ohio, including
the executor, administrator, or beneficiary of the estate of a deceased owner.
   (d)   “Public places” shall include all other grounds owned by the City of
Northwood.
   (e)   “Public trees” shall include all shade and ornamental trees now or
hereafter growing on any public places.
   (f)   “Right-of-way” means any portion of the public way, street, alley or
sidewalk.
   (g)   “Shrub” means a low growing woody plant with one or several perennial
main stems producing branches, shoots, or multiple stems from or near the base
of the plant and incapable of being pruned to provide at least six feet of
clear branchless trunk within five years of planting.
   (h)   “Street” or “highway “ means the entire width of every public way,
easement or right-of-way when any part thereof is open to the public, as a
matter of right, for the purpose of vehicular and pedestrian traffic and shall
include alleys.
   (i)   “Tree” means a tall growing woody plant with one or more perennial
main stems or trunk which develops branches from the aerial section of the stem
rather than from the base; capable of being pruned to at least six feet of
clear branchless trunk below the crown within five years of planting.
   (j)   “Tree lawn” means that part of a street or highway, lying between the
property line and that portion of the street or highway usually used for
vehicular traffic.
   (k)   “Tree topping” means the severe cutting back of limbs to stubs of
three inches or more in diameter within the tree's crown to such a degree as to
remove the normal canopy and disfigure the tree.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.02  DUTY OF PRIVATE PROPERTY OWNER.
   (a)   It shall be the duty of any property owner owning or occupying
property bordering on the right-of-way upon which property there may be trees
or shrubs to prune or cause to be pruned such tree or shrub in a manner that
they will not shade or obstruct street lights, street signs or obstruct
pedestrian or vehicular traffic on sidewalks or streets.
   (b)   It shall be the duty of any person owning or occupying property
bordering on the right-of-way upon which property there are any trees or shrubs
which are designated by the Tree Commission as dead, dying, diseased, or
hazardous or deemed a menace to the health, safety, and welfare of the people
of Northwood, to remove or cause to be removed said tree(s) and/or shrub(s).
   (c)   In either of the above situations, the City Public Service Director
shall send a written notice to the property owner indicating the required
action (pruning or removal) to be taken. A period of 30 days from receipt of
this letter shall be permitted for the property owner to effect the indicated
action. Should the property owner or occupant fail to comply, it shall be
lawful for the Public Service Director or his agent to enter upon the property
and cause such action. The property owner or occupant shall be charged treble
the actual cost of the work and cash payment shall be made within 30 days or
triple the actual cost of the work shall be assessed to the property taxes.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.03  CITY MAY REMOVE.
   (a)   The City may remove or cause or order to be removed, any trees or part
thereof which by reason of its nature is injurious to existing sewers, electric
power lines, gas lines, water lines, other public improvements, persons, or
personal property.
   (b)   The City Administrator shall examine or cause to be examined every
tree within 100 feet of any sanitary or storm sewer, drain manhole, or other
public utility line above or below the surface of the ground, which has been
reported as dangerous to or causing interference with said sewer, drain,
manhole or public utility line, and if found dangerous or causing damage or
obstruction of such sewer, drain, manhole or public utility line, he shall give
to the property owner written notice of their findings and an order that such
person remove said tree or injurious part thereof within 45 days. Service of
such notice shall be as described in Section
1032.02(c).
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.04  CITY RESPONSIBILITY.
   (a)   Whenever it is necessary for the City to remove a tree from the City
right-of- way, the City shall remove such trees and replace them or plant, on
another right-of-way area, an equal number of trees to the satisfaction of the
Tree Commission.
   (b)   No person or property owner shall remove a tree from the right-of-way
for any reason without approval from the Tree Commission. Should approval be
given for the removal, the person shall be required to replant or replace an
equal number of trees at the landowner's cost. The Tree Commission must approve
the replacement or replanting. Failure to plant replacements shall result in
replacement by the City and treble the actual cost shall be billed to the
property owner.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.05  TREES PROHIBITED ON PUBLIC PROPERTY.
   (a)   Trees shall not be planted on public property without specific consent
of the Public Service Director.  The Public Service Director shall only allow
tree as provided by the Tree Commission and its guidelines.
   (b)   Whenever any tree or shrub shall be planted or set out in conflict
with the provisions of this chapter, the City Administrator may cause removal
of the same without obligating the City to replace the illegally planted tree
(s).
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02; Ord. 2005-12.  Passed 3-24-05.)
1032.06  ABUSE OR MUTILATION OF PUBLIC TREES.
   (a)   Unless specifically authorized by the Tree Commission, no person shall
intentionally damage, cut, carve, top, transplant, or remove any tree; attach
any rope, wire, nails, advertising posters, squirrel feeder, or other
contrivance to any tree or shrub; allow any gaseous, liquid, or solid substance
to come in contact with them; set fire or permit fire to burn when the fire or
heat thereof shall injure any portion of any tree or shrub.
   (b)   No person shall excavate any ditches, tunnels, trenches, or alley or
drive within a radius of ten feet from any public tree or shrub without
obtaining approval from the City Administrator.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.07  PLACING MATERIALS ON PUBLIC PROPERTY.
   No person shall deposit, place, store, or maintain upon any public place of
the City any stone, brick, sand, concrete, or other materials which may impede
the free passage of water, air, or fertilizer to the roots of any tree growing
therein, except by written consent of the Tree Commission.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.08  PLANTING AND MAINTENANCE OF TREE LAWNS.
   No person shall plant, prune, brace, cable, spray, or otherwise perform work
on a tree in a tree lawn, public place, City property, or right-of-way without
first obtaining the prior approval of the Tree Commission. The City shall
require the property owner to obtain a permit from the City Administrator. The
person obtaining the permit shall abide by the standards as set forth in this
chapter.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.09  TREES IN NEW SUBDIVISIONS.
   The Tree Commission shall approve the tree plan for any newly developed City
tree lawns.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.10  TREE SPACING.
   The spacing of public trees will be in accordance with the three species
size classes referred to in the Tree Commission's list of Street Trees and no
trees may be planted closer together than the following:
   (a)   Small trees: 30 feet;
   (b)   Medium trees: 40 feet;
   (c)   Large trees: 50 feet
except in special plantings designed or approved by the Tree Commission.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.11  DISTANCE FROM CURB AND SIDEWALK.
   The distance public trees may be planted from curbs or curblines and
sidewalks will be in accordance with the three species size classes in the Tree
Commission's list of Street  Trees and no trees may be planted closer to the
curb or sidewalk than the following:
   (a)   Small trees: Two feet (minimum of a four foot wide tree lawn);
   (b)   Medium trees: Three feet (minimum of a six foot wide tree lawn);
   (c)   Large trees: Four feet (minimum of an eight foot wide tree lawn)
except in special plantings designed or approved by the City Tree Commission.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.12  DISTANCE FROM THE STREET CORNERS AND FIRE PLUGS.
   No public tree shall be planted closer than 35 feet from any street corner;
measured from the point nearest the intersecting curbs or curb lines. No public
tree shall be planted closer than ten feet to any fire hydrant.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.13  UTILITIES.
   No public trees other than those species referred to as Small Trees in the
Tree Commission's list of Street Trees may be planted under or within 25
lateral feet of any overhead utility wire.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.14  TREE COMMISSION.
   (a)   Purpose and Objectives. The primary purposes and objectives of the
Street Tree Commission shall include the following:
      (1)   The Commission, when requested by City Council, shall consider,
investigate, make findings, report and recommend upon any special matter or
question regarding the street or park trees;
      (2)   To hold regular and special meetings at which the subject of trees
insofar as it relates to the Municipality may be discussed by the members of
the Commission, officers, personnel and Council committees of the Municipality
and all others interested in the tree program;
      (3)   To disseminate news and information regarding the selection
planting and maintenance of trees within the corporate limits, whether the same
be on private or public property;
      (4)   To establish the recommended species and varieties of trees to be
planted in the boulevards;
      (5)   To implement an Arbor Day observance on an annual basis; and
      (6)   To establish and maintain, on an annual basis, an inventory of City
street trees.
   (b)   Membership and Terms.
      (1)   The Commission shall consist of five members. Additionally, one
member of Council and the City Administrator shall act as advisory members of
the Commission.
      (2)   The Mayor, subject to the approval of the City Council, shall
appoint all members of the Commission.
      (3)   The Chairperson of the Commission shall preside over all meetings
of the Commission and act as parliamentarian. The Vice-Chairperson shall assume
the duties of the Chairperson in his or her absence.
      (4)   Appointments to the Commission shall be for three year terms
provided that the term for one of the members appointed to the first Commission
shall be for one year and one of the members appointed to the first Commission
shall be for two years.
   (c)   Adoption of Rules. The Tree Commission, with the approval of City
Council, may adopt rules consistent with this chapter which shall provide
detailed guidelines for the administration of this chapter.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)
1032.99  PENALTY.
   Any person violating or failing to comply with any provision of this chapter
shall be, upon conviction or a plea of guilty, subject to a fine not less than
twenty-five dollars ($25.00), nor more than one thousand dollars ($1,000.00)
per violation in addition to any required restitution for damages incurred by
the City or any special assessments levied as provided for herein.
(Ord. 2002-36.  Passed 8-22-02.)

CHAPTER 1040
Water

1222.05(1)
1040.01  EXTENSION OF LINES; ABUTTING AND ADJACENT AREAS.
   Consideration shall be given to the extension of local water lines and water
service in various areas in the Village only upon presentation to Council of
petitions for the same which have been signed by a substantial number of the
property owners in a given area. In the consideration of such petitions, if the
Village is advised by its Engineer that it would be feasible and economical to
include areas abutting upon or reasonably adjacent to an area for which
petitions have been filed, the project may be extended to include such abutting
or adjacent areas without the filing of petitions.
(Res. 67-24A. Passed 11-16-67.)
1040.02  COSTS; CONTRIBUTION OF VILLAGE.
   As to any area seeking the extension of water lines which is represented by
petitions signed by the owners of sixty percent or more of the property
abutting upon the route of the proposed extension, the basic contribution of
the Village shall be limited to two per cent of the overall cost of the
proposed improvement; if no petitions have been filed for a given area or
section of a proposed extension or if the petitions are not signed by the
owners of at least sixty percent of the property abutting upon the route of the
proposed extension, the basic contribution of the Village shall be two percent
of the overall cost of the proposed improvement plus the cost of intersections.
Where it is deemed advisable for purposes of future extensions to install water
lines with greater diameters than immediately necessary to service the areas
involved in a given project, the excessive cost of materials thus resulting
shall be contributed by either the Village or by Wood County.
(Res. 67-24A. Passed 11-16-67.)
1040.03  SPECIAL ASSESSMENTS IN GENERAL.
   All water line extensions shall be financed by special assessments on the
lots and lands bounding and abutting upon the route of the proposed extensions,
assessed upon the basis of front footage, for which purpose the assessable
portion of the improvement shall be the overall cost thereof, less the
contribution of the Village and any contribution by County, State or Federal
agencies. In computing the assessable frontage of lots and lands, as to any
property located at an intersection or where more than one side of a parcel
fronts on the route of the proposed extension, the side with the shorter length
shall be deemed the front of such parcel and shall be assessed for the full
frontage but the other side or sides shall be deemed side frontage and the
first 200 feet thereof shall be excluded from assessment; for such purposes,
land shall be considered in such parcels as determined for real estate tax
purposes.
(Res. 67-24A. Passed 11-16-67.)
1040.04  SPECIAL ASSESSMENTS; DEFERRED PAYMENTS.
   As to lands which are zoned agricultural under the Zoning Code from time to
time and which are undeveloped and unused other than for agricultural purposes
or residential use in connection therewith as of the time of assessment for
water line extensions abutting such parcels, a portion of the special
assessments on such parcels may be deferred, if so elected by the owner
thereof, upon the following basis:
   (a)   For the purposes hereof, a parcel of land shall be as so determined
for real estate tax purposes and each parcel shall be considered as a single
unit irrespective of ownership of other parcels within the assessable area by
the same owner;
   (b)   For purposes of immediate assessment, the assessable frontage of such
parcels shall be limited to 300 feet maximum except that if the frontage
actually used, improved and developed for residential use exceeds 300 feet, the
assessable frontage shall be that frontage actually so used, as determined by
the Street Commissioner and certified to the person charged with the duty of
preparing the special assessment rolls;
   (c)   The assessment on the portion of frontage of such parcels not subject
to immediate assessment as above provided shall be deferred and the amount of
all such deferred assessments shall be paid into the project fund by the
Village. The period of such deferment shall be for a maximum of ten years after
the adoption of the assessment ordinance or such time as such property is
developed for other uses and application is made for a water tap to serve such
property, whichever occurs sooner. The amount of the deferred assessment shall
be reimbursed to the Village by a surcharge on the water tap fee, as provided
in Section
1040.05;
   (d)   The privilege of deferred assessments as herein provided shall not be
made avail able for any projects as to which the deferred assessments as herein
provided would exceed thirty percent of the overall project cost and, further,
such privileges shall be extended only to the extent that sufficient funds are
available from time to time in the Water Tap and Line Extension Fund, as
hereinafter provided.
(Res. 67-24A. Passed 11-16-67. )
1040.05  TAP CHARGES AND SURCHARGES; WATER TAP AND LINE EXTENSION FUND;
APPROPRIATION.
   Rules and regulations respecting taps into the local water lines shall be
promulgated from time to time and made available, the same to be consistent
with the requirements of the source supplying the water service and any
additional requirements adopted from time to time by the Village. The standard
tap charge shall be such amount as determined from time to time by the source
supplying the water service, together with any additional charge imposed from
time to time by the Village for actual services rendered in processing
applications for water taps, for inspection and other related services.
Respecting water taps to serve any parcels which have had the benefit of
deferred assessments, as provided in Section 1040.04, the owner of such parcels
may apply for a water tap to serve any portion thereof up to an aggregate of
300 foot frontage without additional charge. As to water taps to serve a
portion of such parcels exceeding an aggregate of 300 foot frontage, a
surcharge shall be paid computed upon the basis of the number of front feet to
be served which exceed 300 front feet, multiplied by the per foot assessment
which has been deferred. All standard tap charges and surcharges resulting from
deferred assessments shall be paid into a Water Tap and Line Extension Fund,
which is hereby created, the same to serve as a rotary fund out of which the
Village shall pay the amounts of the deferred assessments from time to time. To
initiate such Fund, there is hereby appropriated from the Capital Improvement
Fund the sum of thirteen thousand dollars ($13, 000) and any future
appropriations thereto shall be by separately enacted resolutions to a maximum
of twenty thousand dollars ($20, 000). The Clerk-Treasurer shall maintain a
complete record of all water line assessments, indicating the properties upon
which assessments have been deferred and the cost per front foot of each line.
This record shall be kept up to date and information therefrom made available
to all interested parties.
   The installation of all water taps shall be the responsibility of and at the
expense of the property owner, under the supervision and subject to the
approval of the Street Commissioner.
(Res. 67-24A. Passed 11-16-67. )
1040.06  POLICY DEVIATIONS.
   The provisions of Sections
1040.01 to
1040.05 are intended to express the general policy of Council as of the date
hereof (Resolution 07-24A, passed November 16, 1967), which policy can be
amended at any future time and Council reserves the right to make reasonable
deviations from such policy for special situations or because of unusual
hardships, in which event no person shall have any claim against the Village
because of such changes or inconsistencies.
(Res. 67-24A. Passed 11-16-67. )
1040.07  TAPS GENERALLY; PERMIT REQUIRED; FEE.
   (a)   In order to properly control information on all future water taps for
domestic, commercial, industrial or other purposes which are made within the
Village limits, before all taps can be made each person desiring to make such a
tap shall apply to the Clerk-Treasurer and sign the necessary forms and pay a
fee as set forth in Chapter 208 of the Administration Code - the General Fee
Schedule, for each tap.
   (b)   Such permit fee does not preclude the establishment of any tap charge,
inspection fee or assessment cost for any applicant for a water permit, but
shall be solely for the purpose of providing necessary information as to the
establishment and location of such taps.
   (c)   Such applicants shall also make necessary application to the other
political subdivisions that have jurisdiction over such matters, such as the
City of Toledo Water Division, the City of Oregon Water Division or the Wood
County Sanitary Engineers Office and written approval must be obtained from
such agencies prior to the construction of any water or sewer taps.
(Ord. 73-77. Passed 12-13-73; Ord. 94-59. Passed 11-22-94.)
1040.08  TAPS FOR EXISTING IMPROVEMENTS.
   Local land owners desiring to obtain a water supply for their premises with
respect to existing improvements shall make application for a water tap to the
Clerk-Treasurer using permit forms prepared and furnished by the Clerk-
Treasurer for such purpose, wherein all relevant and useful information
respecting the premises to be served is entered. Upon filing of such permit
forms, the applicant shall thereupon make application to the Department of
Public Service, Division of Water, City of Oregon or Toledo, for an inspection
permit, pursuant to all rules and regulations prescribed by such Divisions. In
that connection, the applicant shall pay all charges levied for the permit and
for the water tap or otherwise, as regulated from time to time by the City of
Oregon or Toledo.
(Res. 68-9. Passed 6-13-68. )
1040.09  TAPS FOR NEW CONSTRUCTION.
   Local landowners desiring to obtain a water supply for their premises with
respect to improvements and construction commenced after the date hereof
(Resolution 68-9, passed June 13, 1968) shall make application for a water tap
to the Clerk-Treasurer using permit forms prepared and furnished by the Clerk-
Treasurer, wherein all relevant and useful information respecting the premises
to be served is entered. Thereupon, the applicant shall make application for an
inspection permit to be processed by the Wood County Building Inspector. Upon
approval of such new construction and proposed local water tap, the applicant
shall then make application to the Department of Public Service, Division of
Water, City of Oregon or Toledo, for an inspection permit, pursuant to all
rules and regulations prescribed by such Divisions. In that connection, the
applicant shall pay all charges levied for the permit and for the water tap or
otherwise, as regulated from time to time by the City of Oregon or Toledo.
(Res. 68-9. Passed 6-13-68. )
1040.10  ACCOMMODATION LINES AND TAPS.
   (a)   The accommodation water line and/or tap shall be subject to the
following provisions:
      (1)   The accommodation water line and/or tap may be granted to an
applicant in the Village if, in the judgment of the Village, such installation
is feasible from the standpoint of engineering.
      (2)   The accommodation water line and/or tap must be made and installed
within the public right of way.
      (3)   The applicant shall install and maintain the accommodation water
line and/or tap at his own expense and such installation shall be in conformity
with such rules and regulations as are present at the time of the installation.
      (4)   No more than one accommodation water line and/or tap shall be
allowed for any one parcel.
      (5)   At the time of the application for the accommodation water line
and/or tap, the applicant shall pay to the Village a fee as set forth in
Chapter 208 of the Administration Code - the General Fee Schedule. In all
instances, applicants shall pay for the actual front footage when such frontage
is less than 300 feet.
   (b)   All funds collected under the provisions of this section for the front
footage charges shall be deposited and maintained in a special water line
construction fund to be used for future construction of service lines in areas
to be serviced where such accommodation water line and/or tap fees have been
paid into the fund.
   (c)   Applications for accommodation water line and/or taps shall be made on
such forms as may be prescribed by the Mayor and shall contain such covenants
and agreements as may be necessary to carry out the intent and provisions of
this section.
   (d)   Property which is serviced by an accommodation water line and/or tap
and for which the charges as set forth in this section have been paid by the
applicant shall not be assessed for any improvement by way of construction of
service water lines in, over or along the property which is being serviced by
the accommodation water line and/or tap and for which funds have already been
deposited with the Village.
   (e)   Each application for an accommodation water line and/or tap shall
contain the full legal description of the parcel of ground or property to be
serviced, and only one such accommodation water line and/or tap shall be
installed for each parcel of property.
(Res. 69-1. Passed 2-6-69; Ord. 94-59. Passed 11-22-94.)
1040.11  TAP CHARGE FOR OREGON ROAD CONNECTIONS.
   (a)   There is hereby adopted a tap charge for any person connecting to the
Oregon Road water line, which tap charge shall be at the rate set forth in
Chapter 208 of the Administration Code - the General Fee Schedule.
   (b)   Before connecting to the water line, the owner of the property shall
apply to the Zoning Inspector, which application shall include a description of
the lands to which the permit applies and the use of such land for which the
connection is requested. Such permit shall be issued upon payment of the charge
for the use of any number of acres set forth in the application. In the event
that there is any acreage less than one acre, then the minimum fee for any
connection shall be as set forth in Chapter 208 of the Administration Code -
the General Fee Schedule.
   (c)   The amounts herein set forth constitute the basic tap charge and shall
be effective for two years after the effective date of this section (Ordinance
74-13, passed January 24, 1974). The amount shall thereafter increase at the
rate of three percent per year for the next ten years and thereafter shall
remain the same as the charge at the end of the twelfth year from the effective
date of this section.
   (d)   All tap charges paid under this section shall be paid into the General
Fund.
(Ord. 74-18. Passed 1-24-74.)
CHAPTER 1044
Sewers

Wood County for treatment of sanitary sewage. Copies of the latest relevant
legislation may be obtained from the Clerk of Council.
1044.01   Taps; permit fee.

1044.01  TAPS; PERMIT FEE.
   (a)   In order to properly control information on all future sewer taps for
domestic, commercial, industrial or other purposes which are made within the
City limits, before all taps can be made, each person desiring to make such a
tap shall apply to the Clerk- Treasurer and sign the necessary forms and pay a

Chapter 208 of the Administration Code - the General Fee Schedule, for each
sewer tap.
   (b)   Such permit fee does not preclude the establishment of any tap charge,
